vendors.name: Amazon Athena
vendors.description: Serverless interactive query service for analyzing data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. Pay-per-query pricing model ideal for cost-conscious teams.
vendors.cost_notes: $5 per TB scanned. Optimized with Iceberg partitioning to reduce scan costs 70-90%.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-4-marcus-journey

vendors.name: Dremio
vendors.description: Data lakehouse platform with SQL query engine, semantic layer, and data catalog. Eliminates ETL pipelines by virtualizing data across multiple sources.
vendors.cost_notes: Subscription pricing based on compute units. Includes semantic layer and data catalog.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Splunk Enterprise Security
vendors.description: Security information and event management platform with real-time analytics, correlation, and threat detection. Industry standard for enterprise security operations.
vendors.cost_notes: Per-GB ingestion pricing ($150-200/GB/year). Costs escalate rapidly with data volume and retention requirements.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-4-marcus-journey-incumbent

vendors.name: Starburst Enterprise
vendors.description: Enterprise distribution of Trino (formerly Presto) with query federation, data mesh capabilities, and governance features. Queries data where it lives without movement.
vendors.cost_notes: Subscription pricing based on compute capacity. Includes data governance features.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Denodo Platform
vendors.description: Data virtualization platform enabling real-time access to distributed data sources without replication. Strong in federated queries across heterogeneous systems.
vendors.cost_notes: Subscription pricing based on CPU cores and connectors. High operational overhead requires dedicated team.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Snowflake Data Cloud
vendors.description: Cloud data warehouse with data lake capabilities, supporting semi-structured data and Iceberg tables. Strong data sharing and governance features.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption pricing (compute + storage). Costs can escalate with inefficient queries or continuous compute.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Databricks Lakehouse Platform
vendors.description: Unified analytics platform built on Apache Spark with Delta Lake. Strong ML/AI capabilities and open lakehouse architecture with Unity Catalog governance.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption pricing (DBUs + storage). Strong ML capabilities justify premium for data science-heavy use cases.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Elastic Security (SIEM)
vendors.description: Open-source SIEM built on Elasticsearch with threat hunting, detection, and response capabilities. Strong search and visualization features.
vendors.cost_notes: Per-GB ingestion pricing. Open-source option available but requires operational expertise.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: IBM QRadar SIEM
vendors.description: Enterprise SIEM with advanced threat detection, log management, and compliance reporting. Strong in regulated industries (finance, healthcare).
vendors.cost_notes: Subscription pricing based on events per second (EPS) and flows per minute (FPM). High upfront licensing costs.
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Microsoft Sentinel
vendors.description: Cloud-native SIEM built on Azure with AI-driven threat detection, automated response, and deep Microsoft ecosystem integration.
vendors.cost_notes: Per-GB ingestion + storage pricing. Strong value for Microsoft-centric organizations (Azure AD, M365, Defender integration).
vendors.evidence_source: book-chapter-3-vendor-landscape

vendors.name: Trino
vendors.description: Open-source distributed SQL query engine for big data, formerly Presto SQL. Federated query across 50+ data sources with ANSI SQL support and MPP architecture.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Costs are infrastructure only. Starburst offers commercial support and enterprise features.
vendors.evidence_source: trino.io documentation, Apache Software Foundation

vendors.name: Apache Drill
vendors.description: Schema-free SQL query engine for Hadoop, NoSQL and cloud storage. Distributed MPP architecture with support for complex data and multiple data sources in single query.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only costs. Schema-free design reduces ETL overhead.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache Drill documentation, Apache Software Foundation

vendors.name: Google BigQuery
vendors.description: Serverless enterprise data warehouse with built-in ML and BI capabilities. Petabyte-scale analytics with standard SQL and integrated security features.
vendors.cost_notes: Pricing editions: Standard ($0.04/GB), Enterprise ($0.06/GB), Enterprise Plus ($0.10/GB). 10 GiB storage and 1 TiB queries/month free tier.
vendors.evidence_source: Google Cloud BigQuery pricing 2025, cloud.google.com

vendors.name: CrowdStrike Falcon LogScale
vendors.description: Next-gen SIEM with real-time log management and threat detection, formerly Humio. Petabyte-scale streaming analytics with sub-second search across hot data.
vendors.cost_notes: Unlimited plans available. Low TCO compared to traditional SIEMs. Real-time performance at scale with 365+ days hot data retention.
vendors.evidence_source: CrowdStrike Falcon LogScale documentation, Intezer SIEM guide 2025

vendors.name: Sumo Logic Cloud SIEM
vendors.description: Cloud-native SIEM with real-time threat detection and automated investigation. AI-powered response with MITRE ATT&CK framework integration and premium threat intel feeds.
vendors.cost_notes: Credit-based consumption model. Startup tier $500-1K/month. Enterprise 100GB-5TB/day: $5K-50K+/month. Free tier: 500MB/day.
vendors.evidence_source: Sumo Logic pricing 2025, sumologic.com, Comparitech review

vendors.name: Chronicle Security (Google Security Operations)
vendors.description: Cloud-native SIEM built on Google infrastructure with petabyte-scale analytics. 12-month hot retention, sub-second search, and Gemini AI-powered natural language queries.
vendors.cost_notes: Subscription pricing. Forrester study cites 240% ROI. VirusTotal and Mandiant threat intel included. Google infrastructure scale.
vendors.evidence_source: Chronicle Security documentation, Vendr pricing data 2025, Forrester Wave Q2 2025

vendors.name: Securonix Unified Defense SIEM
vendors.description: Unified SIEM platform with advanced UEBA, SOAR, and threat detection. Cloud-native architecture with machine learning for behavioral analytics and automated response.
vendors.cost_notes: Starting at $67K annually. GB/day pricing with tiered packaging (Standard, Advanced, All-In). Hybrid pay-as-you-go model with overages.
vendors.evidence_source: Securonix pricing 2025, securonix.com, Gartner Magic Quadrant 2025 Leader

vendors.name: Exabeam Fusion SIEM
vendors.description: Cloud-scale SIEM with advanced UEBA and automated threat investigation. AI-powered timeline correlation with Nova AI copilots for SOC automation.
vendors.cost_notes: Pricing: $75K-355K/year or $250/user/year. Flexible models: user-based or GB/day. Costs escalate with ingestion volume.
vendors.evidence_source: Exabeam pricing 2025, exabeam.com, SelectHub SIEM review

vendors.name: Rapid7 InsightIDR
vendors.description: Cloud-native SIEM with XDR capabilities and behavioral analytics. Asset-based pricing with deception technology and automated containment for threat detection and response.
vendors.cost_notes: Per-asset pricing: $5.89-30/asset/month (500 asset minimum). Small environment: $2K-5K/year. Enterprise: $30K-150K+/year.
vendors.evidence_source: Rapid7 InsightIDR pricing 2025, rapid7.com, Underdefense pricing guide

vendors.name: Devo Platform
vendors.description: Cloud-native security data platform unifying SIEM, SOAR, and UEBA. Sub-second query performance with 400 days hot data retention and AI-powered ThreatLink automation.
vendors.cost_notes: Custom subscription pricing. 400 days hot data retention (vs expensive 90-day limits elsewhere). ThreatLink reduces alerts to manageable cases.
vendors.evidence_source: Devo Platform documentation, devo.com, PeerSpot reviews 2025

vendors.name: Delta Lake
vendors.description: Open-source storage framework extending Parquet with ACID transactions. Unified batch and streaming with UniForm for Iceberg/Hudi interoperability. Databricks-native but multi-engine.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only costs. Databricks, Spark, Athena, Trino, BigQuery support. UniForm enables Iceberg/Hudi compatibility.
vendors.evidence_source: Delta Lake 4.0 documentation, delta.io, Linux Foundation Delta project

vendors.name: Apache Hudi
vendors.description: Open lakehouse platform optimized for fast upserts and streaming ingestion. LSM-tree architecture with incremental processing, CDC support, and multi-modal indexing.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only costs. Optimized for streaming data and CDC pipelines. Onehouse offers managed service.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache Hudi 1.0 documentation, hudi.apache.org, Apache Software Foundation

vendors.name: Apache Iceberg
vendors.description: Open table format for huge analytic datasets. Winner of format wars with universal multi-engine support (Spark, Trino, Flink, Snowflake). ACID, time travel, hidden partitioning.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only costs. Lowest operational overhead. Databricks (Tabular acquisition), Snowflake natively support.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache Iceberg documentation, iceberg.apache.org, Apache Software Foundation

vendors.name: Apache Calcite
vendors.description: SQL query framework providing parsing, optimization, and validation. Foundation for Hive, Drill, Flink, Druid query engines. Heterogeneous data source federation.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Framework for building query engines, not standalone product. Requires significant engineering investment.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache Calcite documentation, calcite.apache.org, Apache Software Foundation

vendors.name: Apache Kafka
vendors.description: Open-source distributed event streaming platform for high-performance data pipelines, streaming analytics, and mission-critical applications. Industry standard for real-time data streaming.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure costs only. Security features require API gateway integration. High operational overhead.
vendors.evidence_source: kafka.apache.org, Data Streaming Landscape 2025

vendors.name: Confluent Platform
vendors.description: Enterprise Kafka distribution with managed cloud service. Serverless autoscaling, 400K partition support, and reduced TCO by up to 60%. Fully managed Apache Kafka with enhanced features.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption-based eCKUs (elastic Confluent units) with autoscaling. Free trial $400/month. Annual commitments offer discounts. Reduces TCO vs self-managed Kafka by 60%.
vendors.evidence_source: confluent.io pricing 2025, Vendr marketplace

vendors.name: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
vendors.description: Fully managed serverless streaming service for real-time data ingestion from apps, IoT, clickstreams. On-demand and provisioned capacity modes with simple pay-as-you-go pricing.
vendors.cost_notes: On-demand: $0.015/GB ingested. Provisioned shards: $0.015/shard-hour. 24-hour free retention. Data Analytics billed per KPU (1 vCPU, 4GB memory).
vendors.evidence_source: AWS Kinesis pricing 2025, CloudZero guide

vendors.name: Apache Flink
vendors.description: Stateful stream processing framework with exactly-once semantics. Flink 2.0 introduces disaggregated state storage (ForSt) for cloud-native deployments. Industry standard for complex event processing.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Confluent offers managed Flink service (serverless). Infrastructure-only for self-hosted. Kubernetes Operator simplifies deployment.
vendors.evidence_source: Flink 2.0 release notes, flink.apache.org, Confluent Platform

vendors.name: Apache Pulsar
vendors.description: Unified messaging and streaming platform combining RabbitMQ queuing with Kafka streaming. Multi-tenancy, geo-replication, and 1M topics at <10ms latency. Cloud-native architecture with decoupled storage.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only. StreamNative offers managed service. Multi-tenancy reduces per-workload costs vs Kafka.
vendors.evidence_source: pulsar.apache.org, IBM Apache Pulsar overview, IDC 2025 data

vendors.name: Redpanda
vendors.description: Kafka-compatible streaming platform with 10x lower latencies and 6x cost reduction. C++ architecture eliminates ZooKeeper and JVM overhead. Serverless and BYOC deployment options.
vendors.cost_notes: Serverless pay-as-you-go (ingress, egress, storage, partitions). $300 free trial (30 days). 3-6x cost savings vs Kafka. Follower fetching reduces data transfer 60%.
vendors.evidence_source: redpanda.com pricing 2025, AWS Marketplace

vendors.name: Azure Event Hubs
vendors.description: Fully managed real-time data ingestion service processing millions of events/second. Kafka-compatible with autoscaling and Premium tier for high-end streaming. Azure-native with seamless integration.
vendors.cost_notes: Basic: $0.03/hour. Premium: Variable PU pricing (1-16 PUs). Throughput Unit: 1MB/s ingress, 2MB/s egress. Free 100 connections (Basic), 1000 (Standard).
vendors.evidence_source: Azure Event Hubs pricing 2025, azure.microsoft.com

vendors.name: Google Cloud Pub/Sub
vendors.description: Serverless messaging service with auto-scaling and 99.9% uptime SLA. No partitions or provisioning required. Synchronous cross-zone replication with per-message receipt tracking.
vendors.cost_notes: First 10GB/month free. ~$15/TB throughput after free tier. Storage: $0.10-0.21/GiB-month (first 24h free). $300 trial credits for new users.
vendors.evidence_source: Google Cloud Pub/Sub pricing 2025, cloud.google.com

vendors.name: Apache Storm
vendors.description: Real-time distributed stream processing system with 1M+ tuples/sec/node performance. Lightweight architecture for edge computing. Spouts and bolts topology model for complex event processing.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only. Lightweight for edge deployment. Lower operational overhead than Flink for simple streaming.
vendors.evidence_source: storm.apache.org, Apache Storm vs Spark 2025 comparison

vendors.name: RabbitMQ
vendors.description: Reliable message broker supporting AMQP, MQTT, STOMP, HTTP, WebSockets. Clustering and replication for high availability. Ideal for microservices task queues with guaranteed delivery.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Mozilla Public License). Infrastructure-only. Low latency for request-response patterns. Message persistence and retry mechanisms included.
vendors.evidence_source: rabbitmq.com, Erlang Solutions 2025

vendors.name: Datadog
vendors.description: Unified observability platform with infrastructure monitoring, APM, log management, and Cloud SIEM. Real-time threat detection with AI-powered security monitoring and DevSecOps integration.
vendors.cost_notes: Pro: $15/host/month. Enterprise: $23/host/month. DevSecOps Pro: $22/host/month. DevSecOps Enterprise: $34/host/month. Multi-dimensional usage-based pricing.
vendors.evidence_source: Datadog pricing 2025, UnderDefense guide, Vendr marketplace

vendors.name: New Relic One
vendors.description: Full-stack observability platform with APM, infrastructure monitoring, and digital experience monitoring. 100GB free data ingest with 780+ integrations and AIOps capabilities.
vendors.cost_notes: $0.30/GB data ingest (100GB free). Core users: $49/user/month. Full platform users: $99/user/month (Standard tier). Data Plus: $0.50/GB with extended retention.
vendors.evidence_source: New Relic pricing 2025, CloudZero guide, SigNoz comparison

vendors.name: Dynatrace
vendors.description: AI-powered observability platform with Davis hypermodal AI engine. 3rd generation platform with Grail data lakehouse and autonomous intelligence. Enterprise-grade with AI observability for GenAI.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption-based pricing with volume discounts. Premium enterprise pricing. Custom quotes through sales. AI observability for LLM monitoring included.
vendors.evidence_source: Dynatrace pricing 2025, TechRadar review, State of Observability 2025

vendors.name: Splunk Observability Cloud
vendors.description: Cloud-native observability suite with APM, infrastructure monitoring, RUM, and synthetic monitoring. Pre-built dashboards, AI Assistant, and intelligent problem detection.
vendors.cost_notes: Infrastructure: $15/host/month. Apps + Infra: $60/host/month. End-to-End: $75/host/month. Standard discounts 28-48% (real cost: $60K-$84K for 200 hosts end-to-end).
vendors.evidence_source: Splunk Observability pricing 2025, Vendr marketplace, TrustRadius

vendors.name: Honeycomb
vendors.description: Developer-first observability with distributed tracing and BubbleUp anomaly detection. AI-native suite (Honeycomb Intelligence) with event-based pricing. Native OpenTelemetry support.
vendors.cost_notes: Event-based pricing: Free (20M events/month). Pro: $130/month (100M events). Scales to 1.5B events. Unlimited users and services. Honeycomb Intelligence AI included free.
vendors.evidence_source: Honeycomb pricing 2025, G2 reviews, CTO Club review

vendors.name: Amazon S3
vendors.description: Industry-leading cloud object storage with 99.999999999% durability. Foundation for data lakes with seamless integration to Athena, EMR, Redshift Spectrum. Multiple storage classes for cost optimization.
vendors.cost_notes: Standard: $0.023/GB/month (first 50TB). Glacier: $0.004/GB/month. Intelligent-Tiering auto-optimizes. New users: $200 free credits (6 months, July 2025+).
vendors.evidence_source: AWS S3 pricing 2025, nOps guide, CloudChipr analysis

vendors.name: Azure Blob Storage
vendors.description: Massively scalable object storage for unstructured data with 99.999999999% durability. SFTP support, hot/cool/cold/archive tiers, and Reserved Capacity discounts.
vendors.cost_notes: Hot: $0.018/GB/month (first 50TB). Cool: $0.01/GB/month. Cold: $0.0036/GB/month. Archive: $0.00099/GB/month. Reserved Capacity discounts available.
vendors.evidence_source: Azure Blob Storage pricing 2025, CloudZero breakdown, CloudChipr guide

vendors.name: Google Cloud Storage
vendors.description: Scalable object storage with Standard, Nearline, Coldline, Archive classes. Low-latency workloads with encryption at rest/transit, IAM, and object versioning. BigQuery and Vertex AI integration.
vendors.cost_notes: Standard: $0.020/GB/month. Nearline: $0.010/GB/month. Coldline: $0.004/GB/month. Archive: $0.0012/GB/month. $300 trial credits for new users.
vendors.evidence_source: Google Cloud Storage pricing 2025, Elite Cloud guide, TechAnnouncer 2025

vendors.name: MinIO
vendors.description: High-performance S3-compatible object storage for AI/ML and analytics. Multi-gigabit throughput per node with native Kubernetes deployment. Most widely tested S3 alternative (tens of thousands of users).
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (AGPL v3). Infrastructure-only costs. Enterprise Edition available. Full S3 API compatibility. Exabyte-scale deployments with sub-10ms latency.
vendors.evidence_source: MinIO documentation 2025, min.io, S3 Compatible Storage Benchmark

vendors.name: Ceph Object Storage (RGW)
vendors.description: Open-source distributed storage with S3 API compatibility. 111 GiB/s GET throughput achieved (2025 benchmarks). Storage tiering with cloud integration and no single point of failure.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (LGPL). Infrastructure-only. 3× throughput increase (4→12 nodes). Storage tiering to cloud. Exabyte-scale capability. Commercial support from Red Hat/Mirantis.
vendors.evidence_source: Ceph benchmarking 2025, ceph.io, Ubuntu Ceph guide

vendors.name: Apache Atlas
vendors.description: Open metadata management and governance for Hadoop and beyond. Data classification, lineage tracking, business glossary, and Apache Ranger integration for RBAC/ABAC security.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only. Complex deployment. Hadoop-optimized but supports multi-platform. Ranger integration for fine-grained access control.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache Atlas documentation, Atlan guide 2025, Secoda introduction

vendors.name: Collibra Data Intelligence
vendors.description: Unified data catalog, governance, quality, and AI governance platform. Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader 2025. Data lineage, GDPR/HIPAA compliance, and centralized policy management.
vendors.cost_notes: $170K (12-month), $340K (24-month), $510K (36-month) yearly subscription. Base licensing ~30-50% of total (connectors/users extra). Gartner Leader 2025.
vendors.evidence_source: Collibra pricing 2025, data.world analysis, SelectHub review

vendors.name: Alation Data Intelligence Platform
vendors.description: Agentic data intelligence platform with 120+ connectors. AI-powered documentation, policy enforcement, and data product delivery. Pioneer in modern data catalog (founded 2012).
vendors.cost_notes: Starting ~$20K annually (entry). Enterprise ~$198K/year. Asset-based pricing model (2025). Complex pricing with hidden costs noted by users.
vendors.evidence_source: Alation pricing 2025, Atlan comparison, SelectHub review

vendors.name: AWS Glue Data Catalog
vendors.description: Serverless metadata catalog and ETL service. First 1M metadata objects free. Schema Registry with Apache Avro support. Lake Formation integration for unified governance.
vendors.cost_notes: First 1M objects free. $1 per 100K objects/month beyond. Crawlers: $0.44/DPU-hour (10min minimum). Schema Registry included free. Lake Formation no separate charge.
vendors.evidence_source: AWS Glue pricing 2025, CloudChipr breakdown, Hevo Data guide

vendors.name: Microsoft Purview Data Governance
vendors.description: Unified data governance with pay-as-you-go pricing (January 2025 model). Governed assets and DGPU-based data health management. No cost for scanning, charge only for governance.
vendors.cost_notes: New model (Jan 6, 2025): Pay for governed assets only (no scan cost). 200 governed assets example: $100/month (30 days). DGPU: 60min compute unit for data quality.
vendors.evidence_source: Microsoft Purview pricing 2025, Erwin de Kreuk analysis, Azure documentation

vendors.name: Apache NiFi
vendors.description: Real-time dataflow automation with drag-and-drop UI. Low-code data integration for ETL processes with data provenance tracking. Cloud-agnostic with improved performance for AI streaming (2025).
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only. Real-time low-code advantage over Airflow. Cloud-agnostic. Job market value strong for 2025.
vendors.evidence_source: Apache NiFi documentation, Refonte Learning 2025, DataCamp comparison

vendors.name: Airbyte
vendors.description: Open-source ELT platform with 600+ connectors and AI-assisted builder. Capacity-based pricing with free self-hosted option. Cloud, self-hosted, and Enterprise (BYOC) deployment.
vendors.cost_notes: Free OSS self-hosted. Cloud: Capacity-based (Data Workers, not volume). Mid-market: $500-5K/month. Enterprise: $50K+/year. 600+ connectors included.
vendors.evidence_source: Airbyte pricing 2025, Vendr marketplace, Sider.ai review

vendors.name: Fivetran
vendors.description: Automated data pipelines with 700+ connectors. Monthly Active Rows (MAR) pricing per connector. Zero-maintenance architecture with real-time syncing every few minutes.
vendors.cost_notes: MAR pricing per connector (March 2025 change). $25K-200K annually typical. Free, Standard, Enterprise, Business Critical tiers. Bulk discounts removed March 2025.
vendors.evidence_source: Fivetran pricing 2025, 5X comparison, Windsor.ai analysis

vendors.name: Qlik Talend Cloud
vendors.description: Unified data integration, quality, and governance with 1000+ connectors. AI transformation assistant with natural language to SQL. Four editions with capacity-based usage metering.
vendors.cost_notes: Four editions with capacity-based usage (data volume + job executions + duration). $50K-500K+ annually. OSS version free. Custom quotes required.
vendors.evidence_source: Talend pricing 2025, Mammoth.io analysis, AWS Marketplace

vendors.name: Matillion Data Productivity Cloud
vendors.description: Cloud-native ELT for Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Synapse. Maia AI virtual data engineers (2025). Unlimited users/environments with consumption-based pricing. 271% ROI potential.
vendors.cost_notes: Basic: $1K/month. Advanced: $2K/month. Enterprise tier available. Free plan with limited features. Consumption-based with 271% ROI. Unlimited users/environments/scale.
vendors.evidence_source: Matillion pricing 2025, SaaSworthy analysis, Matillion ROI study
